knimeNode.name: Normalize Plates (NPI)
knimeNode.shortDescription: The node performs a normalized-percent-of-inhibition(NPI)-normalization based on two subsets of the data (positive and negative control).

intro.p: Groups of data (e.g. wells of a plates) are normalized relative to two subsets (e.g. some wells within that plate, e.g. some negative control wells and some positive controls wells). For each group the mean (or median) is calculated for the two selected subsets. Based on these estimates, all data points of each group are normalized by applying this formula:

x.npi = (mean(x[subset{positive}]) - x) / (mean(x[subset{positive}]) - mean(x[subset{negative}])) * 100
or
x.npi = (median(x[subset{positive}]) - x) / (median(x[subset{positive}]) - median(x[subset{negative}])) * 100

Therfore x.npi values resemble the "percentage of inhibition", where the positive subset is defined as 0% and the negative subset as 100%. By swapping the two subsets the definition will be "percentage of activation" and negatives will be set to 0% and positives to 100%.

Literature: Malo et al., Nat. Biotechnol. 24, 167-179 (2006)
Â
It is possible to normalize without grouping (e.g. normalization of the whole screen based on all negative and positive controls available).

fullDescription.option: Select the column to define the groups (e.g. "barcode" for plate-wise normalization).
Select the columns with data to be normalized.
Select the column which contains the label defining the reference subset (e.g. treatment)
Select a subset (representing maximum activation) that is used to calculate mean (median) for each group
Select a subset (representing maximum inhibition) that is used to calculate mean (median) for each group
If checked the raw values will be replaced by the normalized values. Otherwise columns with the normalized values will be appended - ".npi"
Median will be calculated instead of mean.
The default column suffix ".npi" can be changed

option.name: Load a limited number of columns

fullDescription.option: If big data tables create memory problems, the number of columns read in memory (subset data) can be restricted. Then, statistic calculation will be done sequential for each set with the given number of columns.

ports.outPort: Table with statistics used for normalization
